headline: Tuna Noodle Casserole I
description: This is easy, filling, and can be quick if you omit the baking step, which I often do.

video.description: Incredibly simple to make, this tuna casserole really satisfies.
video.name: Tuna Noodle Casserole I

name: Tuna Noodle Casserole I

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 2 quart casserole dish with cooking spray.
In a large pot of salted water, boil noodles until al dente. Drain well.

In a medium saucepan, combine flour, butter, and salt. Stir until butter is melted and ingredients are combined evenly. Add milk, and whisk until the sauce thickens (usually it is at the proper consistency by the time it begins to boil). Add cheese to mixture, and whisk until cheese is melted and mixture is well blended. Stir in tuna, peas, and noodles. Spread evenly in prepared dish.
Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this recipe, but made a few changes. I added two cans of tuna fish, a little bit more cheese, garlic, pepper and some season all. After I put it in the baking dish I added some bread crumbs. It turned out really good.

This was good. I followed the recipe but substituted green beans for the peas. Only complaint is, I think it was a little dry. Next time, I will add a little more liquid and the wife requested more tuna.

Following the advice of others- I doubled the sauce. (Thankfully!) I used 1c frozen peas, 1 c frozen corn, 2 cans tuna. I Also did half milk and the other half was half & half. lol I tasted the sauce before adding it to the other ingredients and found it to be bland, so I added a few good shakes of oNion powder, some pepper, and a little Italian seasoning. After putting it into casserole dish, I topped it with about 1/3c Italian fine breadcrumbs, it was pretty good! I chose this recipe bc my hubby hates mushroom soup which many recipes call for.

Quite tasty. I added 2 cans of tuna. Pasta by sight for 2 qt casserole. Used lima beans in place of peas. They are more nutritious . They were frozen and I defrosted them on frozen veggie setting in microwave. Used low fat cheese too. If you wish might make a little more sauce. I was happy and so was hubby.
Been making it this way for years. Always turns out great!
I will definitely use more tuna. This recipe didn't have enough.
This recipe is delicious. Only reason for 5 stars is that I did add milk, so it would not be dry.
I used two cans of tuna. The casserole was dry and bland.

I also adjusted this recipe. I added two cans of tuna, drained. One 12 ounce bag of egg noodles. 4 tablespoons of flour, 4 tablespoons of butter. Half a package of cream cheese instead of shredded cheddar. Two cups of milk. Frozen peas instead of can peas. And one can of cream of mushroom soup.
Made on a whim. But didn't bake it. Easy and great flavor!
Added more mushrooms, celery and onions. Yes I will make this again!
I added 1 extra can of tuna and frozen peas corn carrots and green beans 15 iz. It was wonderful

I thought this was a good basic recipe for tuna noodle casserole. Similar to the first one I made in home ec. class at school, but we topped ours with crushed potato chips. It's comfort food for sure!
It was good, my husband gave it a thumbs up!

I made this and it was great, I'm not usually a tuna girl but my fiancee and I loved this. Definitely used two cans of tuna, double the sauce to keep it from getting too dry, only had frozen veggies so used those and added some garlic & parsley as well as a ritz cracker crumble on top!
Easy and Good

Delicious!!! Made as is. The 2nd time I made it: added 2 tsp minced garlic and 1 tsp cayenne pepper as suggested by another reviewer; the garlic I like (maybe more); but the cayenne pepper made it a little too spicy for my taste.
I didn’t add peas because I didn’t have any. I will make it again.
delicious and simple to make

A great basic tuna noodle casserole recipe. We did make a few changes to jazz it up to our tastes. 

Added 1 tsp Herbs de Provence (french herb mix), 1 tsp lemon pepper and the juice of 1/2 lemon. The lemon works well with tuna and "sharpens" the flavor slightly. Topped with crushed potato chips and sprinkled with Parmesan cheese.

Will use this recipe again! Possibly adding onions and fresh mushrooms?

Listened to the reviews and doubled the white sauce recipe which made for a perfect amount. I also used 2 cans of tuna and used old cheddar instead of sharp cheddar. I also added grilled onions and mushrooms to the mix and topped off the casserole with bread crumbs. Very, very tasty!!
This is a simple and delicious classic recipe! It's a perfect go-to comfort, weeknight meal for my family.
Made it. Didn't really like it
This was great, easy recipe. I doubled the cheese sauce sauce and added bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese on top for a crunchy top! It turned out very tasty!

OK ... so this is a great start, but I think I found the sweet spot for the finish: 

- Double the ingredients for the sauce, so the casserole isn't too dry. 
- Add a little bit of water, like maybe 3/4 cup. 
- Add a can of cream of celery soup. Makes a WORLD of difference. 
- 2 tsp. minced garlic
- maybe a tsp of cayenne pepper. or a can of diced green chiles. 

I followed the instructions otherwise, beside doubling everything for the sauce. Used frozen peas - stuck to the prescribed amount. Doubled the tuna., and it turned out awesome. Thanks for recipe!

Definitely a winner esp after moms' day at work with a waiting toddler and hungry husband! It was super quick and easy too- did not bake. I used 2 cans of tuna, mustard, some frozen peas and about a cup of extra milk as I used 3T flour instead of the recommended 2T for approx. half pack of fettuccine pasta. Will be having this again- thanks for sharing :)

Love the idea of making your own sauce for Tuna Noodle and I did as others suggested by doubling the white cheese sauce. BUT used half chicken broth and half milk to make it from being to dry. Gave more flavor too !! Thanks

This was good, family liked it. (I didn't get to try it this time, though). Doubled the sauce, added black pepper and garlic powder to it. Also added some broccoli flowerets and sautéed mushrooms, and 2 cans tuna.
I should have read the other reviews, because it turned out dry. There should have been at least a cup and a half of sauce for this. My husband said it would be better with mushroom soup!

I was looking for a recipe that didn't call for sour cream. This was quick and delicious. I added a small jar of pimentos which added a little kick. This basic recipe can be tweaked any which way, but in a pinch without a lot of ingredients, this was awesome and my husband loved it.

I made this dairy free. I subbed unsweetened cashew milk, vegan butter, & used a few slices of Daisy cheese (probably 5-6 slices). I used unbleached white whole wheat flour. I roasted a head of broccoli, half red onion, & 5 cloves of garlic, w olive oil, garlic powder, s&p. I also used a couple lil dashes offer pepper flakes. After roasting I put all of it in the mix too. I used a bag of frozen organic peas. & a mix of Noddles I had on hand. I used a big can of albacore tuna. Did it all in the same cast iron skillet. Doing it this way does take much longer to prep. But it makes a lot. It was delish! The whole familiar loved it! This was my first attempt to do this dairy free & it was just as good as the original. I will defiantly make it often.
This was awesome! Used elbow macaroni, didn't have egg noodles. Also added a 1/4 tsp of ground mustard. It was creamy and delicious! This will be our go to lunch item. THank you so much for sharing.

This is a good script to throw things together and get a good casserole. I did not have many of the ingredients so I subbed penne for noodles, Monterey jack for cheddar, frozen peas for canned & seasoned bread crumbs for chips. Based on others' reviews, I increased butter & flour to 3T each and used 1-1/2 c of milk. I added 1 t. oregano and a hefty sprinkle of garlic powder. I also sauteed 1 chopped celery rib, 1/4 c. red onion and 2 chopped mushroom and added those. So I basically transformed the recipe but it was very good and would be tasty with cooked chicken instead if tuna and any cooked veggies mixed in.

This was easy and had a good flavor once baked. The only thing I changed was it was a little dry once it was all mixed together so I stirred in about 1/2 cup of milk before I put it in my casserole dish. Would bake it again. Also sprinkled the top with buttered bread crumbs.

Just put this together for dinner tonight. I could tell from the way it tasted while preparing it that it is going to be delicious. Followed the recipe as written except doubled the egg noodles !! and tripled the sauce & used frozen mixed veggies instead of just peas. Thanks for a great recipe. We both have to watch our sodium intake, so finding a recipe from scratch like this was wonderful !!! Thanks again

I will definitely make this again! I did make changes, trippled the sauce, and tuna, added cream cheese and chives, pepper and a little garlic to the sauce, mushrooms onions , celery, a topped it with parmesian and crumbled crackers...delicious!

This was delicious! My son hates tuna fish, he loved this recipe! I used half and half instead of milk and before baking it I crushed up Ritz crackers and crumbled them on top then I added Locatelli cheese. It's was a hit!

I used twice the tuna, Parmesan instead of cheddar, and frozen peas instead of canned. Next time I'll also add sauteed onion to give it a little more flavor. Perfect comfort food, easily tweaked to your preferences.
Great Tuna Casserole Recipe. Double sauce, double tuna, use slightly sauteed mushrooms instead of peas, add dash of cayenne pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, celery seed. My 12 year old loved it!

i added a can of cream of mushroom soup... awesome addition! i saw a recommendation of sprinkling bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese on top... i think that would be a nice touch at the end, uncovered. BTW, i baked covered and had no issue with it being dry.

Definitely 5 starts with a couple of modifications. I doubled the tuna, added 1/2 cup sour cream to the sauce and used sharp cheddar. I also used broccoli instead of peas just because that's what I had on hand. The casserole was moist but not soupy and very flavorful. Great weeknight meal made with pantry staples.

I am just stunned how this recipe turned out without using mushroom soup! I was nervous about it and of course read other reviews and made sure the cheesesauce was to my liking, but I am glad I gave it a shot. Okey well I didnt have cheddar, only colby. So since I love it this way, I'm keeping it this way lol.

Was looking for some comfort food on this cold November day- this recipe really hit the spot! I used about 2 cups of frozen peas instead of canned but stuck with the rest of the measurements. I did top my casserole with a little bit more cheese as well as some fried onion strings before sticking in the oven. Thanks for the great recipe!

Great base recipe. I decided on dinner last minute, and didn't have the canned soups I have always used-- this is much better! I had to triple the sauce recipe, but it turned out great! I added frozen veggies, a little garlic and minced onion and italian seasonings. I recommend with a little broccoli and birds eye steam fresh mixed veggies.
Bland and dry. I'd also use fewer noodles.

The first time i made this recipe, i did make more sauce, but it did not have a good taste. The next time i made it i used 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/4 teaspoon ground mustard, 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper.Doubled the tuna and still doubled the sauce. Used velveeta cheese, not sharp cheddar. As written a two star, as i make it a five star.Sometimes i use ( cream of chicken soup from scratch ) from this web site, very good soup.I use it instead of the sauce that comes with the recipe
Added some pepper and red pepper flakes for a little zest but otherwise a really good recipe.
Delicious. A bit thick though, but adding some more milk to it sorts it out.

I only gave it four stars cause I made alterations. I wanted to add more flavor, so I followed a previous review and used onion soup mix the first time I made it. The second time however, I couldn't find the mix, so I used french onion soup instead of the milk. I added a bit of thyme and red wine, doubled the sauce mixture and the tuna. I also used more cheese because my DH and I both are cheese lovers:) it comes out delicious every time!!

This is a great substitute recipe if you do not have soup on hand. I made double the sauce (based on other reviews) and used 2 cans of tuna. I also suggest adding French fried onions into the casserole and also ripping it with them for the last 5 minutes. My picky 11 year old son ate 3 bowls of this. Easy and delicious.

I liked this recipe as a base for a "canned soup free" tuna casserole. I personally like more flavor, so I added 1/2 tsp paprika, 1/4 tsp of ground mustard, 1/4 tsp ground black pepper, a dash of cayenne, and 1 tsp of dried chopped onion. I put panko on top as well, and as another reviewer said, I thinned out the sauce a bit with some reserved pasta water. Thanks :)
This is our favourite!
Excellent! Super easy and flavorful! I added French's fried onions to the top the last 5 minutes.
I was looking for a no soup, less expensive recipe. I added some sour cream, pepper, and parsley. Very good.

I've made this twice now -- first time because I realized I had no cans of soup so I did an i-search for a "tuna casserole no soup" recipe -- I was very pleasantly surprised at the creamy outcome! 
I gave it 4 stars because twice now I've deviated: 2nd time I made it I had to put in less peas -- I'm not one to need a pea in every bite. Also, I add shredded cheddar and mozzarella along with breadcrumbs (seasoned with pepper and onion powder) to the top before I bake, to give it a nice, crispy crust. 

I also tried this second time with homemade noodles (feeling frisky, I guess) -- YUMMMM!!!

Overall, though, very good and easy recipe.
I am not big on the mushroom flavor in tuna casseroles so I loved this recipe though I only gave it 4 stars because it needs more taste. My family added more salt.

I was searching for a tuna casserole recipe that didn't use cream soups and came across this one. I used 12oz noodled, tripled the sauce and doubled the cheese and tuna. I also added some pepper, celery seed, and oregano because the sauce was bland and threw in a bag of frozen carrots, celery, and onion. It was delicious! Leftovers were yummy too, and I liked that were was no crumb topping to get soggy. Will definitely be making again!

I liked this recipe because it did not require cans of soup. It is a good starter that enabled me to be creative. Instead of plain milk, I first mixed it with a vegetable dip mix (like Simply Organic's Creamy Dill, Ranch or French Onion) before adding to the sauce pan. I omitted salt since the dip and cheese had plenty of sodium. I also doubled this sauce mixture to prevent the drying out of the tuna casserole when it is baking in the oven. In addition, I doubled the tuna and also added chopped onion and celery. It was fabulous!

This is a super easy recipe and I, by no means, am even an average cook. It was tasty, flavorful and came out on my very first try. I did substitute peas for broccoli though because my husband is allergic to peas. I will definitely cook this again.

This has become my "go to" recipe for tuna casserole. I love it! Don't tell my mom but I like it better than hers. The only modification I make is to double the sauce, because I like a really saucy casserole. It's delicious as is but can easily be dressed up by adding some sauted mushrooms and onions, or any other vegetables of your liking. I also like to top it with cracker crumbs and parmesan cheese.
I doubled the recipe for a family of 5. I used elbow macaroni instead of egg noodles & used velveta cheese instead of sharp cheddar. I also topped with parmesan cheese. It was very good.

We love this casserole, with the following modifications: double the butter, flour, milk, cheese, and tuna. We use mini pasta screws which make it more springy and less potentially glued-together than the egg noodles.
I used a cup of macaroni noodles instead of egg noodles but it turned out great! I'd definitely fix it again.
Good, hearty, tasty and not unhealthy! Thanks!
Delicious! Only thing I had to change was I used velveta block cheese bc I was out of shredded cheese, and i added some onion and garlic powder, mine wasn't dry at all, it tasted amazing!
This doesn need extra salt. I added and extra T of flour, butter and about 1/3 more cup or milk. I think it is really good with these modifications!!!!!
I doubled the sauce and it was great! Even better the next day. I will make this again and again.

Great base recipe...tweaked it in almost every way! I'm not a huge fan of condensed soups and like to make as much as I can from scratch. I used pepperjack and parmesan instead of cheddar. I also used half and half in place of milk, doubled the recipe and used two, 12 oz cans of albacore tuna, sprinkled a couple dashes of red pepper and cut about 4 cups of fresh spinach up to add into the mix. YUM!
This was great I added half a pack of onion soup (dry mix) and some sour cream mozz cheese was great!!! added extra tuna too!

Pretty Good, but would have bland without changes. 

I added diced onions and a minced garlic clove and let them simmer in the butter for a while. I also added paprika, and several dried peepers.

To make the recipe healthier, I doubled the tuna and only used about 1/4 cup of cheese (mixed chedder and mozz). To keep it creamy I added a big scoop of plain greek yogurt. Wheat noodles added some fiber, and since people were complaining of dryness I added some vegetable broth to the sauce. 

I also sprinkled crushed Saltines to the top to give a little crunch. It turned out tasty and was easy to make.
No one is my family liked this. I really thought my 4, 2, and 1 year would but they didnt care for it. Had to double cheese sauce as well. Will not be making this again.
Double recipe sauce and add sour cream. Saute minced garlic with onions. Use garlic powder and lemon pepper seasonings. Add can of peas.

This was so good, I ate the whole thing in two days. I made more of the Rue and milk then called for and used frozen mixed vegatables (peas, carrots, etc) instead of the canned peas, and I put Panko bread crumbs on the top. Delicious.
great dish, I doubled the recipe and added an extra can of tuna. I love tuna!
I used broccoli instead of peas and added bread crumbs. baked until crunchy. DEEEELISH

I doubled the cheese sauce (a must), adding garlic powder, crushed red chilies, pepper, dried minced onion, and a pinch of celery seed, and used a large pouch of tuna. I also added some lightly steamed broccoli. In place of the egg noodles, I used whole wheat bow-tie pasta. I covered it in the oven for the first 10 minutes, than added Panko bread crumbs tossed with a little butter and left it uncovered for the rest. I used the broiler at the end to deepen the top crust. The husband loved it, and I'm happy that there was plenty for leftovers later in this busy week. This recipe is a good base, and I'm looking forward to varying the spices and vegetables in the future.

Great basic recipe!! I am the only one in our household that will eat tuna casserole! So I do not eat it very often. I used leftover egg noodles from last nights dinner and leftover garlic and cheese croutons smashed on top. Surely not my mother's tuna casserole!! Quick and easy and very forgiving. Add what you like and take out what you don't!! YUMMY!!

Very tasty, easy, and you can easily use any type of pasta or noodle on hand that you may be trying to finish off. The major change I would make would be to definitely ADD more TUNA. The more tuna, peas, and broccoli you could add would increase the health benefit for more fat/calorie content eaters. So fast, will make again on a night I need to put dinner on the table without much time.
Additions are fine, but the fact remains that this is a great basic recipe for tuna noodle casserole that doesn't include that horrible can of soup!
Great recipe! I added a little beacher's flagship cheese and parm to the sauce and broiled it for like 5 min at the end. YUM!

Pretty tasty, and very filling. I took the advice from other comments and doubled the cheese sauce. Also used lowfat buttermilk instead of milk, but less butter. Added cayenne, black pepper, and garlic powder, but omitted salt, which may have been a mistake. topped with crushed triscuits for a nice crunch. Would add frozen instead of canned peas next time, and maybe mushrooms too.
Made it without baking for a quick lunch. Put leftover croutons in the food processor and mixed it into the noodles. It definitely could have used some seasoning, though.
Fast, easy and great week night meal. I add a cup of shredded cheddar cheese.

I followed the advice of many of the reviews - I doubled the tuna & the sauce (and added about a half cup extra milk). The texture was fine, but it still probably could have done with more sauce. I used chopped fresh baby portobello mushrooms and a bag of frozen mixed veggies instead of canned peas. I also used a light celtic cheddar from trader joe's and added a little frank's hot sauce just to make sure it wouldn't be bland like so many tuna noodle recipes. The boyfriend and I both had seconds :)

I just made this - never made tuna casserole before, and was delighted by how simple it was. I had most of the ingredients in my cupboard, but substituted the egg noodles with pasta. I think it'll be a winner with the kids. and on our weekly dinner menu.

This is a good start. I doubled the sauce using triple cheddar blend instead of sharp cheddar, used frozen peas instead of canned, added 1/4 cup sour cream to the sauce. I also added an extra can of tuna and topped it with crushed potato chips. I added my own seasonings since it needed some flavor. It is good if you can't have a lot of salt and need to avoid canned soups.

As is this is very bland; I like the idea of homemade sauce rather than canned soup. This might be fine for younger children but people with a more mature palate will want to add onions, celery, possible chili flakes or hot sauce, or other herbs to their liking. I chop an onion, stalk of celery and nuke them with a bit of butter until slightly soft, then add to the rest of the ingredients.

Good recipe, I added a package of ranch dressing mix (dry) after adding the milk while making the sauce, only because I had it on hand. It turned out GREAT! So play around with this recipe with what you have in the cubbard. Have fun cooking everyone!
My husband and I loved this recipe. I doubled the sauce and the tuna.
Nice change from can soup version. Followed other suggestions to double the sauce ... nice and creamy!
I didn't like this.
Extremely dry. Add more sauce when using this recipe.

Four stars! This recipe is a good starting point, something to tinker with different ingredients like veggies and seasonings. The sauce is very much like what you would use in a from-scratch mac and cheese, and worked well. I used some cooked elbow macaroni I had on hand instead of the egg noodles so mine was very much like a mac-n-cheese dish, but the egg noodles would be great. Honestly, I just eyeballed how much cooked noodles to use for how much sauce I made so I can't really comment on the noodle-to-sauce ratio in the recipe. I doubled the sauce as others suggested, but for the small can of tuna I use that was excessive. The sauce was bland, so I had to kick it up a notch with some spices. May fave was hot sauce. I aso used cooked frozen carrots and peas instead of the can. My kids were so hungry I didn't put mine in the oven, but it reheated great in the oven for lunch the next day so the step isn't totally useless. Overall, a keeper. Thanks Cat!
I love this recipe. I added Mrs. Dash as my seasoning and love how the lemon flavor blends in with the tuna flavor
I really love this recipe. It was super easy and really yummy. I did double the sauce. I also have tried it with canned pink salmon too. So delicious.

We thought this was good but I had to leave out the salt due to dietary restrictions. I used a few shakes of Mrs Dash instead. I agree it needs more sauce but I just doubled the milk and it worked just fine. We don't care for canned peas so I used frozen. Lastly I crushed some herbed croutons and sprinkled on top and it was dinner. My 4 yr old gobbled it up!
I had mixed veggies instead of a can of peas, I also added 2 cans of tuna but found it was a little dry. I think a little more sauce and I would have given it 5 stars.

I made this last night as a last minute, no meat on Friday meal. It turned out really good. I ended up using a mix of cheddar and shredded mexican cheese (not the kind with taco seasoning). I also added some crushed up buttered Ritz crackers for a cruncy topping. Good base recipe that you can really do a lot with depending on what kind of flavor you are looking for.
My hubby loved it, I on the other hand can't eat hot tuna. Need to make more of the milk, cheese mixture to make it creamier.
